hints.label: def-physical-observables
hints.title: Gauge-Invariant Observables
hints.content:
1094: :label: def-physical-observables
1095: 
1096: **1. Wilson loops** (holonomy around closed paths):
1097: 
1098: For closed loop $\gamma = (e_1, e_2, \ldots, e_L, e_1)$:
1099: 
1100: $$
1101: W_\gamma = \text{Tr}\left(\prod_{k=1}^L U_{e_k}\right) \in \mathbb{R}
1102: $$
1103: 
1104: **Properties**:
1105: - Gauge-invariant
1106: - $|W_\gamma| \le 2$ (dimension of SU(2))
1107: - Measures enclosed gauge field curvature
1108: 
1109: **2. Total interaction probability** (SU(2)-invariant):
1110: 
1111: From {prf:ref}`prop-su2-invariance`:
1112: 
1113: $$
1114: P_{\text{total}}(i,j) = P_{\text{clone}}(i \to j) + P_{\text{clone}}(j \to i)
1115: $$
1116: 
1117: This is the **correct** SU(2)-invariant observable, not individual directional probabilities.
1118: 
1119: **3. Plaquette expectation values**:
1120: 
1121: $$
1122: \langle W_{\square} \rangle = \frac{1}{Z} \int \mathcal{D}[A] \, \text{Tr}(U_{\square}) \, e^{-S_{\text{YM}}}
1123: $$
1124: 
1125: **Interpretation**:
1126: - $\langle W_{\square} \rangle \approx 2$: Weak coupling (small field)
1127: - $\langle W_{\square} \rangle \ll 2$: Strong coupling (large field)
1128: 
1129: **4. Noether charge expectation values**:
1130: 
1131: $$
1132: \langle Q_{\text{fitness}} \rangle = \frac{1}{Z} \int \mathcal{D}[\Psi] \mathcal{D}[A] \, Q_{\text{fitness}} \, e^{iS}
1133: $$

hints.label: thm-cluster-decomposition
hints.title: Cluster Decomposition for Wilson Loops
hints.content:
1139: :label: thm-cluster-decomposition
1140: 
1141: For non-overlapping Wilson loops $\gamma_1$, $\gamma_2$ separated by $d \gg \rho$:
1142: 
1143: $$
1144: \langle W_{\gamma_1} W_{\gamma_2} \rangle \approx \langle W_{\gamma_1} \rangle \langle W_{\gamma_2} \rangle \quad \text{as } d \to \infty
1145: $$
1146: 
1147: **Physical significance**: Ensures locality of gauge interactions.
1148: 
1149: **Fractal Set context**: Correlation decays exponentially:
1150: 
1151: $$
1152: \langle W_{\gamma_1} W_{\gamma_2} \rangle - \langle W_{\gamma_1} \rangle \langle W_{\gamma_2} \rangle \sim e^{-d_{\text{alg}}(\gamma_1, \gamma_2)/\rho}
1153: $$
